subject: Philosophy
title: The Tao That Can't Be Named
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Tao That Can't Be Named.

hook.text: The Tao Te Ching opens with a paradox: 'The Tao that can be spoken is not the true Tao.'

buildup.text: Lao Tzu wrote this around 500 BCE. The Tao is the way of nature â€” the flow underlying everything.

discovery.text: You can't define it because definitions limit it. The Tao is beyond language and concepts.

twist.text: Yet Lao Tzu wrote an entire book about it. That contradiction is itself very Taoist.

climax.text: The Tao isn't a god or a force. It's the natural order that exists when you stop interfering.

punchline.text: Name it and you've already missed it.

quiz.question: Why can't the Tao be fully defined according to Lao Tzu?
options: It's a secret only priests know
